Reviews.Title: “I loved this place”
Reviews.Author: candida6752
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the upstairs front room of this Decco historical landmark and loved it. I like "unusual" and the motel had that in droves. The corner room had lots of windows and the sun poured in in the late afternoon - and the room is furnished like a bedroom so it feels cheerful and cozy. The owner warned me about the noise from the streetcar but I didn't really mind it very much. It was infrequent and loud - but very San Francisco. I loved the private communal hot tub but I was a little confused at first on how it worked. You ask for the key and then you are the only user until you relinquish the key. I was travelling alone and felt kind of selfish doing it this way. But it was blissful sitting in the little garden area in the really nice hot tub. I found the owner to be a little unpleasant - the only down side to the motel. The bed was comfy, everything was clean and the part of the city that it is in is really fun - right across the street from the Zoo and I took serveral wonderful walks along Skyline Blvd trail near the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Must love "vintage"”
Reviews.Author: kindercathe
Reviews.Content: If you don't love "vintage" you may not appreciate the Ocean Park Motel. I wasn't sure what I was getting, but we enjoyed ourselves here. The rooms here are much smaller than you may be used to, but this place has everything you need. The property is beautiful and the staff so helpful. We loved the location. The zoo and the beach are right here. The trolley can't be more convenient and parking is free. We stayed in a queen suite and used the kitchen quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Motel”
Reviews.Author: 1kidandpoodle
Reviews.Content: We read ALL the reviews on tripadvisor and felt we needed to give this little motel a try! We love hotels/motels with character and wanted something on the outskirts of town. It does take longer to get to most of the tourist attractions but it was worth it. Don't come looking for flat screen TV's or fancy foo foo bedding but if you want a place that won't gouge you on ridiculous parking fees and hidden room charges this is perfect. We enjoyed the landscaping and cozy feeling. Everything is so neat and clean you forget this motel was built in the 1930's! We especially enjoyed the friendly owner that made sure we had everything we needed when checked in. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “cute little place”
Reviews.Author: cheryl l
Reviews.Content: The only negatives I have are: the remodel work looks a bit shoddy. As a person who has a contractor husband, it's hard to not notice the caulking around the shower, the obvious paint over paint over paint on the door of the bathroom, and little things like that. The window in the kitchen was also cracked which allowed cold air to seep in. The windows are of the old latch-style and most don't close tightly. Would also like to see the chair in the second bedroom taken out to allow for a dresser and second TV. Normally TV wouldn't be a necessity but we spent the first two days there sick in bed so it was needed. The ice cube trays in the freezer were empty save for two cubes. would have been nice if they had been filled up. Other than that, the host of the property was nice and friendly. he held our bags so we could go eat prior to checking in. All in all a nice stay. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “March 2012”
Reviews.Author: suwick
Reviews.Content: I first booked this property because they take dogs and the price was great. We will go back for the ambience, the history, the terrific owners, and the hot tub. This gem is a treasure. We go to SF for the Park and this is very easy access to it. It is a step back in time with the comforts of home. We had a kitchen which saved money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, near a lot of family friendly attractions and reasonable $ too”
Reviews.Author: musheded
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first time in January 2012. I found the place by accident because I was looking for hotels in San Francisco on an online site and someone happened to mention this place in their review of another. What a find! This place is 'old school' a family owned place that only accepts reservations over the phone. The owner and his wife gave us a discount since the weather was supposed to be somewhat gloomy/cold when we visited, though it turned out to be fantastic weather anyway. We stayed in a room with two beds and a full kitchen (yes a real kitchen with a stove/oven, fridge, microwave, coffee maker and sink that was perfect for our little family. The only drawback to the room was the floor heater (though authentic for the time period it was built) since at the time our daughter wasn't always walking, but she couldn't crawl on it so we just shut the heater off and it turns out we didn't really need it on anyway. The hotel has free (that's right in San Francisco, across from the zoo and a couple blocks from the beach!) parking, that was nice after a long drive there and playing all day to just come back and relax (and have a place to put left overs :)). We were able to walk to the SF Zoo and to Ocean Beach. We also went to nearby Golden Gate Park and took our daughter to the awesome playground they have there (sadly the carousel was closed). The folks at Ocean Park also gave us the names of a bunch of family friends restaurants nearby, as well as a nearby store and laundry since when you have little kiddo you sometime need both. Overall we had a great stay at the Ocean Park Motel and loved the art deco decor, just a nice place and nice people, and we can't wait to go back and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great art deco beach getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Zephyr11_11
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend at the Ocean Park Motel in San Francisco. The location for this place can't be beat. Let me repeat: CAN'T BE BEAT. This hotel is one short block from the San Francisco Zoo, and the beach. The muni picks up right on the corner. Perfect location. The management at this motel actually cares about you. The place looks more like an art-deco apartment complex. Our little suite was like a one-bedroom apartment with another bed in the living room. We had a small bathroom and a full kitchen. The bedroom had a door for privacy from the other queen sized bed in the big room. Perfectly clean and very comfortable. The management gives you a lot of information that is incredibly helpful. Four typed pages that they have put together to make a San Francisco visit more fun. They explain exactly how to use the public transportation and what the best deals are for their visitors. A very personal touch. The Wi Fi in our room worked great. The only reason I can't give it a 5 is the noise. It is near a muni turnaround so there is a little noise from the trains and you can hear the ocean waves. Not everyone minds this (I actually liked the noise and considered it part of the ambience), but just in case ear plugs are provided in the rooms. They worked great for one of the people in our party. For breakfast in the morning we walked around the block to a John's Ocean Beach Cafe and had a fantastic breakfast. There was another breakfast place that looked great nearby but we didn't have a chance to visit. We did stop by the garden center that was across from the motel. On our first night we drove down the Great highway to the Cliff House for dinner (it was only a few minutes away). I felt like the owners/managers of this motel actually cared about me and that they truly valued my business. It was refreshing from the chain hotel experience. I would definitely stop by the Ocean Park Motel if you are staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Economic option for families visiting SF”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderer26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Park Motel in early November 2011. We are a family with younger kids vacationing in SF for a week. The Ocean Park Motel was a great option for us. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: --Clean, safe, and ample parking. --Our room had a fully functioning kitchen (not sure if they all do), but the full sized fridge and gas stove allowed us to make breakfast in and pack lunches most days, and offered a good place to store leftovers,etc. --Is 10 yards from a MUNI trolley that goes directly downtown (no need to switch and trolleys were very frequent) --Within walking distance of the Zoo, the beach, and a good cafe and pizza place. --Easy to drive most places from here and very easy to find/get to. Cons: --Very loud. That trolley I mentioned is convenient, but also goes directly by the building, and if you have young kids it can keep them up/wake them up the first couple of nights. --WiFi is totally unreliable. With our smartphones this wasn't a huge issue, but if you are in any way planning on relying on the WiFi, don't. --Little small. This is a good spot to come back to at the end of the day after dinner, and get up an go in the morning, but if you think you'll be spending any significant amount of time in the rooms, just be advised they're small. Our rooms didn't have desks or anything like that and no real space for kids toys or anything like that (although the kitchen had a 2-person table). Overall I would definitely recommend the Ocean Park Motel for families looking for economic places to stay while seeing SF.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you have dogs or are going to the beach”
Reviews.Author: sargentmom
Reviews.Content: Good if you want to experience the art deco of yesterday. Very convenient to the beach. They do allow dogs. They have a hot tub but we were not interested in a public hot tub in San Francisco. There is no a/c and the heat is tricky to operate. They open the windows after they clean, so if you come back at night it is cool. They did not provide us with clean washcloths, towels, yes. No kleenex, needs more shelving in bathroom or somewhere to put your stuff. We would not have paid the amount we were charged if we had known all this. I could find a better place, cheaper, more convenient and with breakfast for what they charge. I based my stay on the reviews I read here, don't believe them all. Rooms are small. Mold in the shower! You need earplugs for traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, location”
Reviews.Author: DMC454
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay. The motel had a wonderful period charm, it was quiet, clean and felt very safe. The room wasn't posh and the bathroom was small by modern standards but it was clean and comfortable. It was close to the beach, which was great for an evening walk. The management was very relaxed and friendly. Parking was easy, handy and free. We enjoyed having breakfast and coffee at the Java Beach coffee shop, which I'd also highly recommend, and which was just around the corner. We took the transit into the downtown area one day - it worked fine getting us into the downtown area but I would not recommend transit for moving from one down-town sight-seeing location to another. We found the downtown buses to be extremely crowded and not very pleasant - I might take transit into the downtown area but another time I'd investigate tour bus companies for actually getting from one site to the next. Also - I'd agree with the reviewer who commented on the temperature - it was colder than I expected, so dress in layers and be prepared for the day to warm up or cool down.

Reviews.Title: “History and views!”
Reviews.Author: ellinad01
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay. First, it's seriously cute. Second, it's close to important stuff. Like the L -- which got me across town, no problem. Also it's close to the zoo and the beach. I was thrilled to be able to get up and go for a walk first thing in the morning. Third, the rooms are small, but clean. And most importantly, safe. The staff was friendly, kind and helpful. Fourth, there are a few places to eat close by. Fifth, no problem parking, either. I enjoyed my stay and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: sunsetd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in September. It's one of the oldest motels in town, so yes, you can tell by looking at the interior of the building. But everything was clean and we felt very safe. Staff was very nice, supportive and accommodating. There were enough parking spaces for free and the L train right at our door step was pretty convenient. The wifi was a little bit spotty but we were told upon check-in so it was no big deal. It was just a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rexcab
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the end of August thru the beginning of Sept. I was in one of the courtyard rooms. I enjoyed my stay and slept well, even with the "L" train passing thru. The room was clean and had a comfortable bed. The bathroom was also clean, but it may be too small for some people's tastes. Internet was spotty, but I knew that going in. The free parking is great! There was an incident on my last night that involved some shouting , the crash of broken glass, and the appearance of the police. I'm not sure what happened, but in the morning, I saw the office glass boarded up. I was leaving fairly early, so I dropped off my key with one of the housekeeping staff and went on my way. Other than that, my stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “A nicely maintained classic”
Reviews.Author: Denny G
Reviews.Content: This place opened in 1937 and is credited with being the first motel in San Francisco. About the only place that it shows its age, other than the Streamline Moderne architecture, is the size of the rooms and carports. I consider it a bit pricey but the place is extremely well taken care of and you are getting a touch of history

Reviews.Title: “Great location but really noisy”
Reviews.Author: moongoddess3001
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a street room and the upside was you are right nest to metro and the down side is you are right next to metro , the train is SUPER loud I can sleep through anything but if your bothered by noise don't stay in their street rooms . We really liked the room it was nice and homey . The staff was quite friendly , and polite and helpfull the only down side was we ran into a pummeling issue with our bathroom sink and they assured us it would be fixed but it never was , so no sink for 2 day. Overall a truly awsome location and I will stay again I'll just be sure to bring draino.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: norfolk23
Reviews.Content: I could not fault ocean park, found it on trip advisor. Like everything it is all about what you want to pay for and what you are looking for. I wanted a proper American motel and ocean park was perfect. Simple, cOmfortable and clean - with parking. The motel is a good 30 minutes on the very frequent muni and two good local cafes just around the corner. One upscale and the other not. Zoo and beach a short walk. Only drawback is taking the Muni late night back to motel is NOT for the fainthearted. My story is seeing the most amazing fistfight - real bare knuckle stuff take place over a seat. A bit scary but a highlight of the trip and something to tell the folks back home.

Reviews.Title: “Start your day with a walk at the edge of the ocean”
Reviews.Author: Occi0
Reviews.Content: This super clean, very comfy and utterly charming historic motor court has a wonderful location a block or so from the walking/biking path along the Great Highway at the edge of the Pacific Ocean. Start your day by joining the lucky locals with a brisk walk along this path --sun or fog it is always bracing and tourist-free. Parking at the Ocean Park is free (versus $45 /night at many popular bay-side hotels), muni is at the door, and the airport is a quick shot down the freeway. If muni is not your thing, a 20 minute drive will get you to the Ferry Building downtown, that is if you take a decently long morning walk and leave the motel after 9 am. Do ask for a quieter room if noise is a bother as muni rattles and screeches around the corner regularly from early morn to late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a San Francisco vacation spot for families.”
Reviews.Author: M0useNDaH0use
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Park Motel Saturday, July 2nd through Tuesday, July 5th and considered ourselves incredibly lucky to do so! We didn’t settle on our final trip dates until the weekend before and were understandably confronted with few affordable options in San Francisco for the 4th of July weekend. We ‘discovered’ the Ocean Park Motel on TripAdvisor and immediately contacted them to see if they could accommodate us. Marc got back to us right away and told us that he could get us in if we were flexible. He was able to get us into a 2-queen kitchen unit for the Saturday night stay and then we moved into a 3-queen family suite for the final two nights. We really enjoyed both rooms. The first room was a little small for ourselves and our 3 young girls, but we loved the full kitchen. There was only one thing that was very tough for me. I’m 6’2 and the bathroom was about the size of a postage stamp; my knees hit the sink when ‘using the facilities.’ Overall, though, the room fit our needs very well. We missed the full kitchen when we moved to the larger room, but the additional space in the bedroom and bathroom area more than made up for it. I preferred the location on the second floor as it felt somewhat more private and ‘special.’ The mini-fridge was actually a fairly large one and all of our cold items fit easily. The location was terrific. The motel is only 2 blocks from the beach and 2 blocks from the zoo. The cafes on Sloat Blvd. are very close and very high quality. If public transit is needed, well, the L Taraval train runs right out front. The parking lot is small, but we never had any problem finding an open space for our minivan. The motel’s kids play area was really cute and very very San Franciscan. Watching my kids play there reminded me of my time growing up in San Francisco! The staff was great. When we arrived, we were greeted with a smile and given a great information sheet that came with recommendations for local walks and dining options and personal reviews from the staff to help guide us. They moved our luggage from our first room to the second room for us and we never had any problems to report to them. There are a couple of things that people should be aware of when booking rooms. The larger 3-queen suite has only 1 TV and it’s in the room with 2 queen beds in it. I think most families will put their kids in there, which means that the parents will be left without a TV to watch when their kids are asleep. It’s inconvenient, but not a dealbreaker by any means. Also the second floor is reached by narrow steep stairs with a curve. Disabled or less-able individuals may find this difficult to deal with. If neither of these minor issues bothers you then the Ocean Park Motel is a terrific option. Families will be hard-pressed to find a better option in San Francisco. My family and I plan on staying here every time we visit home from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, friendly, inviting, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: culdesacSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in order to visit family in San Francisco, and were pleased with the location, for starters. Being right on the L train line is a plus - it goes right by our daughter's home. The owners were friendly and helpful. It is close to Java Beach Cafe - good coffee, breakfast, sandwiches. The quaint art deco and nautical design is appealing and inviting, although because it is old, the rooms are on the small side. Our grandson stayed with us one night - and the two bedroom plus kitchen room was perfect. He liked the little swing set/garden area. We had a quiet, restful stay and will be returning when we are in San Francisco next time. Very close to walking/jogging path along the ocean at Great Highway.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: ChrisChaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in May and loved it. The owners have put in a great deal of work to keep the motel in it`s original Art Deco, Ocean Liner style. Beautifully kept gardens and trees and a fine neon sign all add to the atmosphere. Rooms were clean and furnished in sympathetic style. Trams into the city centre are frequent and inexpensive and there is a nice friendly local Cafe where we had breakfast. Being so close to the Pacific Ocean was a definite plus. We will definitely stay again if we return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful little motel island in the city”
Reviews.Author: AnotherColin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed ourselves. The retro motel atmosphere is fantastic, things have been kept up to date though, no worries there. We wanted a place away from the city bustle and with easy parking as we had a rental car for the next 2 weeks of our trip but intended mainly using public transit while in San Francisco. The Ocean Park delivered on both counts, we slept like babies and the off-street, often covered, parking was just what we needed. Some people here mentioned noise from the street car outside, we hardly heard anything even though it was close (and great for a direct trip to downtown). We did notice ear plugs were provided for the light sleepers though, a nice touch. Service was over expectations. Our luggage got delayed at SFO and even though the airline decided to deliver it to the motel at 2am when reception was well and truly closed, we found a note under the room door in the morning letting us know our luggage was secure at the reception. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed!”
Reviews.Author: NorCalErin
Reviews.Content: Charming and quaint, this is a great place to stay in SF especially if you've already done the time in downtown hotels/hustle bustle/chaos and want an opportunity to see the beach and a more relaxing side of the City. It isn't the place for people who want a Four Seasons (although the service is just as good - included a four page FAQ on just about everything you need to have a great stay!), but its a great place where you can be yourself and enjoy the City *your* way. The room was absolutely charming, ours had a kitchenette complete with dishes, etc. If our schedule would have permitted, we would have stayed an extra day! We stayed in number 8 - wifi worked great.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem... quiet, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: petegardner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights during a trip to San Francisco and loved it... as long as you accept it for what it is, a 1930's motel designed as inexpensive accommodation for working people, and don't expect the bells and whistles of a luxury hotel, then this is a charming and relaxing place to stay, is inexpensive and has bags more character than a regular chain hotel. Even though the room I had wasn't particularly large, it was certainly big enough, and had all the essentials... most importantly, the bed was extremely comfortable and everywhere is kept spotlessly clean. My initial concern that the position of the motel is a little out of the way turned out to be unfounded... the very regular L line streetcar, literally on your doorstep, whisks you downtown in under half an hour, with the added bonus that you get to see parts of the city you wouldn't normally discover if you were staying in the city centre... and if you like riding streetcars, then transfer at Castro and ride the historic F line streetcars down to Market Street or all the way to Fisherman's Wharf The real benefit of it's position is being just a few blocks from the ocean and some splendid walks... there are a couple of good places for breakfast within a few blocks and you are also just a ten minute bus ride away from the Outerlands cafe, which serves some incredible food... all the essential details of places to eat and places to visit, etc., are provided by the hosts on information sheets that they give you upon arrival... and if you require any other information, then they seem very obliging and willing to help All in all, a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mailmanorama
Reviews.Content: My family spent one night here while we visited relatives in the city. We have 2 young children and needed a place with a kitchenette. Our 2-bedroom accomodations (room #1) had a small kitchen with a mini stove and oven, refrigerator, microwave and sink. All pots, pans, cutlery, plates, etc. seemed to be included and there was even a small table with a coffee pot. I thought the kitchen was great! The bedrooms are small, though, especially with 2 queen beds. We couldn't fit the pack-n-play crib in the second room and still close the door. There were no additional desks or chairs, and the TV in the main room sat on the dresser at an odd angle. I don't remember the closet because we didn't look for it nor did we need it, but it must've been in the second room. The bathroom was also a tight fit but it was very clean and the water was hot. The rooms would have a little more space if double beds were used instead of queens, and if the TV was a flat screen mounted on the wall instead of taking up real estate on the dresser. The next morning I walked around the motel with my youngest daughter and noticed all the beautiful plants, especially the succulents. I took her to the small play area and then we walked to Ocean Beach which is only a few blocks from the motel. Before my family checked out, we had a light breakfast at the excellent Java Beach Cafe and popped in at the Sloat nursery to look at the beautiful orchids (it was Winter Orchid Festival week). All in all, it was a very pleasant stay at the Ocean Park Motel. The rooms are small but the kitchenette makes up for that (if you need one). I think this place is great for my family's needs and it's the closest lodging to my relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel WiFi very unreliable”
Reviews.Author: jpreeves
Reviews.Content: This was nice choice for San Francisco. Nice room and bed good parking.Although well outside city,tram stop (end of line-zoo stop) just outside so very easy to get into city and find way back. Tram Price seniors $0.75 regular $2 tickets last 90mins. My only gripe with motel is the advertised WiFi didn't work and this is obviously a common problem as there Is a sign up at the office which blames the lack of reliability down to the old building. Very annoying as we tend to find next hotel by using internet night before. However all is not lost as there is good cafe very nearby with excellent speed (they also provide power points ) and most of their customers were making use of this. Food mostly sandwiches were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: travlelbug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days in San Francisco last month and stayed for the 2nd time at the Ocean Park Motel. It's really a great deal, the rooms are not big and the bathrooms are quiet small but the beds are very comfortable with nice linens and good pillows. If you want to go downtown and not take your car (hard to park and expensive) you can take a trolley bus which takes about 40 minutes to the ferry building. From there we walked all over and hopped on a bus to North Beach for lunch. The owners of the motel couldn't be more helpful and give you a handout on things to do and see in the area. A list of restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The Java cafe has great breakfasts and is only a 1 block from the motel and just opposite the Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely property this is...great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: californiawanderone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights in late October and truly enjoyed ourselves. The rooms were very clean and we loved leaving the windows open for fresh air. The kitchen was light and bright and very helpful to have. After a long day of shopping the jacuzzi was amazing. Upon check-in we were given maps, menus and brochures for the city. Those maps helped my husband master the transit system and we never moved our car! The owners/employees could not have been more helpful or courteous...we loved this place...we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pearljamfans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Park Motel with our son for a long weekend in San Francisco. We loved the 50s feel of the place. Although the bathroom was a bit small, we were very comfortable here and appreciated having a kitchen. We read complaints about the noisy trolley and although we heard it Friday night, we did not hear it Saturday or Sunday night and did not consider it a problem. It was nice that you could walk to the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the right”
Reviews.Author: time-off808
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights during the week of the 4th of July. The place was built in the 30's, and the owners have done a pretty good job of keeping ahead of the natural break-down of an 80 year old building. The rooms are fairly small, but it's a motel, not a condo. The two bedroom unit (at least the one were in) does not have a hallway between the rooms. Consequently, the door to the bathroom is accessed through the main entry bedroom. Long story short, if you are staying with another couple as we were, you get to walk through their room to get to the can at night. Not cool, and not what we have ever encountered before. The price was reasonable and the owners were very helpful. The kitchenette was well stocked with the usual stuff, there was a stove, microwave, coffee pot and the 'fridge was bigger than expected. Parking was off-street and covered. The neighborhood is very quiet. The bad news is that the transit lines run right past the motel. The quiet streets are pierced by the braking / turning noise of the transit cars, and you can hear it through ear plugs. If you are a light to moderate sleeper, this may not be the place for you. Some serious low-lifes managed to get a room while we were staying there. Smoking outside, loud talking at three a.m. in the small courtyard, cops, ambulance for the ride to detox, etc. To the owners credit, they did what they could to keep things under control, they were only there for one night, and a carpet cleaning company was seen the next day getting the place back into shape. It was good to see that they cared about the room and the next occupants. The beach is an easy walk, Java Beach Cafe has killer food, beer, coffee, free internet, the Zoo couldn't be much closer, and as I said, public transit is a snap with the stop being across the street. We will gladly go back

Reviews.Title: “Good feeling right from the start”
Reviews.Author: viv-james
Reviews.Content: We arrived to have the gorgeous Vicky spend about half an hour with us discussing the places we could visit and the best restuarants in the area. The trains and buses were so handy only metres away which made everything so convenient. We worked out the system available in no time at all and we had San Fransicso at our fingertips!! This hotel has won an Art Deco Award and it truly has a special something to offer guests, not too mention the family history associated with the ownership. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted a different experience in San Franisco, It was great living just by the ocean, being runners we loved to be away from city traffic. Although this was the case, it took no time at all to get to all the sites. I would highly recommend this Motel to one and all. Viv James Auckland NZ

Reviews.Title: “Motel, amenities, HOsts, neighborhood - just Great!”
Reviews.Author: curriershouse5
Reviews.Content: On my "bucket list"for 10 years and I made it! The 30's ambience, comfy beds, beach locale, nearby Java joints for breakfast (only if you didn't want to use the fully stocked kitchen) and welcoming hosts JUST GREAT!!! Free Parking! The Outlander restaurant outstanding! The Duffets provide a warm welcome and answer any questions; also, an excellent neighborhood map where you can find anything you might want to buy or eat on West Portal Street - movie theater, too. Ok, I visited in July , mysteriously foggy but cooler that wherever you came from! Take a sweater!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: vaca2010_10
Reviews.Content: We were a little leary about booking a hotel sight unseen. However, all that changed when we checked in. This place was great, had the best night's sleep. Other reviews complained of the noise, that wasn't an issue as we had earplugs on our nightstand! The owner went out of her way to make sure we got to see Alcatraz. I've never been treated better. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here is like a nightmare 'I Love Lucy' comedy sketch.”
Reviews.Author: HumboldtAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this place., it's so cute. Build next to a streetcar line, 2 blks from the beach. This motel is like the one in that 'Lucy' episode where the train comes by every half hour with a loud roar shaking the place to pieces. Here it's a streetcar that starts at 6am and stops at midnight. If you're never there or only from 12-6am, okay. At a $159.50 for a very small room, quiet is expected. They should hand out earplugs at the office with your key. Our next door neighbors made so much noise slamming their front door that the dogs barked all night. Not to mention the two inch gap under our front door next to the bed in this tiny room. The running mini fridge in the closet next to my head was a bit too much. But really I think it was the pit bull staying in one of the rooms that came charging across the parking lot after our neighbors two border collies that really did it. Too small, too noisy, no Wifi. Not enough to distract you from the racket. It's hard to believe that this is a residential area, but the neighbors have time to get used to it, we couldn't. We checked out the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: tsgc2008
Reviews.Content: combined business/pleasure. business portion spent several days at airport hotel, then moved to Ocean park for a few days for the pleasure portion of our trip. we wanted something unique and off the beaten path. based on reviews booked the Ocean park. loved the location and recommendations of things to do. and it was a very unique motel. we had dinner at Lakeside Cafe and Beach Chalet restaurants were very good, we had a car so free parking was a big plus. downside was the room is very, very small. other reviews mentioned this but having been in SF for a full week I had big suitcase and other small bags and normal room was just not big enough for me and the wife and a couple suitcases. Also very small bathroom and small shower, and no fridge. And very cold tile floors in the bathroom, brrrr!! I would stay here again but would book the two room suite with kitchen for extra space. (as a side note, when I booked the room Marc indicated they were out of queen rooms but he would give me the 2 room suite for same price. when I checked in, he switched us to the smaller queen room to allow another guest who was staying with his adult daughter to take the 2 room suite. My loss was their gain apparently as the queen room was very small)

Reviews.Title: “one more glowing review”
Reviews.Author: 81hoosier
Reviews.Content: Redundancy be damned, I'll add my positive review to the previous postings. The location is perfect - in a quiet neighborhood with nice restaurants and coffee shops. A short Muni ride from across the street to downtown, the Mission or Castro. The beach a block away. On the Great Highway and access to Hwy. 1 and Santa Cruz and Monterrey. The rooms are immaculate with retro charm without the neglect and decay of other "landmark" motels. The owners and staff couldn't be more pleasant or helpful. Our kitchen was stocked with every piece of cookware, utensils, and serving pieces that we needed. The grounds are beautiful. One warning - if internet is REALLY important to you, be warned - from what we could tell, the wifi only worked on the landing outside our room, and we were in one of the rooms closest to the office. But, come on....you're in arguably the most beautiful city in the world in a sublimely charming motel. What are you doing glued to your stupid computer? If you really need to access the internet, take the laptop out on your front step, or to the coffee shop (free wifi, great coffee and sandwiches) around the corner. We wholeheartedly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, and Quaint, plus parking and streetcar!”
Reviews.Author: plushpup
Reviews.Content: Having lived in the Richmond District in SF for 9 years, I like to stay in the Richmond/Sunset area when I visit so I can easily access all my favorite haunts. Easy parking, a kitchen, and good public transit are also things I look for in a hotel. And on my most recent trip, I had my dog, so a place that was dog friendly and near the beach was essential. I found all this and more wrapped up in a gorgeous little package at the Ocean Park Motel! The proprietor is as friendly and personable as can be. He and his wife have maintained this GORGEOUS art deco property impeccably, with its lovely gardens and courtyard, beautiful paint job, a great original neon sign (facing out to the street, so not a problem), and festive white lights framing the entryway. I got the sense that there is a wide variety of room setups, some with two rooms, some with one, so I can't speak to all the rooms. However, I was pleased with mine, #6, right at the head of the courtyard. The room was a little small, with just a bed, a dresser (with great cable TV including the digital guide, which you never find in a hotel!), one bedside table, and a small chair. I'd've liked another bedside table with another lamp. The mattress was divine and I slept really, really well. The kitchen was totally cute, and came with everything you'd need, though no mugs to go with the coffeemaker (just small disposable cup things). There was a table with two chairs in the kitchen. The bathroom was really big with a nice shower. No hairdryer, FYI. There was also a really big closet which was great for storing stuff, though it could use a light for finding stuff! The property also has a hottub, though I never had time to use it. The location is, in my opinion, great. It's a block off Sloat, so it's really very quiet. It's just a block from the ocean, which is great. There's a great coffee shop a block away as well. The best part is that the L Taraval streetcar line picks up right by the hotel, so you wouldn't need to drive much at all! (But if you do, there's ample, easy parking.) The zoo is also right by the hotel, across Sloat. I would definitely stay here every time I come to SF. It's hard to find a place that has everything this place has to offer -- quiet, pretty, friendly, parking, kitchen, dog rooms, hot tub, streetcar, beach -- in SF. And it's clean and relatively cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Most Gracious Host”
Reviews.Author: Ctx50
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Fran recently for a conference and stayed at the Ocean Park at the recomendation of those giving the conference. I saw another review that described this place as retro heaven and I don't think I could describe it any more accurately. It is an older motel and the rooms are on the small side but absolutely as clean and neat as can be. The location of the OP is perfect if you like to walk and during the week I was there I walked to the Harding Park Golf Course - site of the 2009 President's Cup Matches, The SF Zoo is across the street, Fort Funston - great if you have a dog, Golden Gate Park - spectacular in every way and, of course, the beach that's only 2 short blocks away. If you're not a walker the trolley car stops right across the street and SF has an awsome public trans system that can take you anywhere for just a couple bucks. Lots of neat places to eat close by that are far better than the usual big chain type dining experience. But the one thing that makes the OP stand out in my mind is the owner, Mark. On my last day there I had called the Super Shuttle to take me to the airport. After 90 minutes and 3 phonecalls where they told me the driver would be 'right there' the shuttle was a no show. Mark put the 'Closed' sign in the window and drove me to the airport himself, apoligizing for the lack of service by the Super Shuttle even though he was not affiliated with them in anyway. I caught my flight with just minutes to spare. I'm a frequent traveler but I don't believe I've ever had a motel owner that went the extra mile to see that his guest was satisfied the way Mark did that day. Two thumbs up for Mark and the Ocean Park!

Reviews.Title: “Still good!”
Reviews.Author: OregonMark
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my exchange students this visit. It worked very well for us, we were able to spread out on the top of one building for a very nice price! location allows visiting the city and also ability to see life out of the tourist area. Nice folks own and work here, nice to do business with locals. Staff is very helpful with information requests! I will not stay anywhere else in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A little Bit of Retro Heaven”
Reviews.Author: bellaanima
Reviews.Content: My Recent stay at the Ocean Park Motel was absolutely wonderful.I had one of the rooms with a full kitchen,which had everything I needed.the entire room was chraming.The Ocean Park is located in a wonderful neighborhood of San Francisco,two blocks to the beach and zoo.If you don't have a car,the public transit is right at the front door.If you like walking,this area is a great place for it. The owners and staff were top notch,always there to help in every way. I felt as though I had come home to a place I had always known. I will always stay at the Ocean Park whenever I come to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Still a favorite after four years”
Reviews.Author: RedwolfCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Since I wrote my initial review for The Ocean Park in 2006 (http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60713-d291227-r5837277-Ocean_Park_Motel-San_Francisco_California.html), I've stayed there for the same event every September, and my delight in the place hasn't diminished a bit. Staying there is one of the highlights of my visit, and something I always look forward to. I recently had the opportunity to visit The Ocean Park in the company of my husband and teenage daughter when we drove up to San Francisco for a concert, which gave me the opportunity to experience more of the motel's amenities (and to see it through the eyes of my family, who had often heard me express my pleasure in the motel), which gives a fresh perspective, so on the advice of my husband, I'm writing another review. I had reserved a room with a queen bed and a twin, but was pleasantly surprised when we arrived to find that we'd been upgraded to one of the motel's small suites, with two queen beds, a full bath, a kitchenette and a dining room. As soon as we stepped into the room, my husband said "wow...I'm impressed!" I have to admit, I was too...I've always stayed in one of the smaller single queen rooms on the courtyard, which are lovely and comfortable, but small...this room was HUGE by motel standards! A small dining area branched off the main/sleeping room, connecting to a nice little kitchen that was better-equipped than any other self-catering accommodation I've stayed in. The bathroom featured a tub as well as a shower, with the deco styling I expect from The Ocean Park. The decor throughout was tasteful and attractive, featuring the diagonal wood paneling that is a hallmark of the motel, set off by soft peach and cream accents. We had plenty of time before we needed to get downtown for our concert, so my daughter immediately set off to enjoy the hot tub (which she says is "really nice!"), while my husband settled down for a nap, and I took the opportunity to read through the hand-outs they give you when you check in. I really wish more hotels/motels did this kind of thing! There was an extensive list of area restaurants, categorized by type, with directions how to get to each (including information on parking and public transit for those that weren't withing walking distance), directions via public transit to major tourist attractions, an area map, and even a suggested city tour using public transit that would hit the major tourist attractions in San Francisco. Speaking of public transit, a lot has been said here about the L-Taraval streetcar, which runs directly in front of The Ocean Park. Yes, it's there, and yes...if you're sensitive to such sounds, it can be noisy (it has never bothered me, even during this most recent stay, when we were in a room right on 46th...and my husband snoozed happily through several passes of the streetcar that afternoon). That said, it only runs until midnight. After that, the L line becomes a regular city bus, which is considerably quieter than the streetcar, and which only comes by a few times during the night. If a bus going by is going to bother you, you're unlikely to be happy in ANY lodging in San Francisco. But, if you are sensitive to sounds like this, and if you plan to be in bed before midnight, you can always request a room near the back of the motel when you make your reservation. We used the streetcar to get into the city center for our concert at The Fillmore, and it only took us 35 minutes to travel from the motel to Powell Street Station (near Union Square and the Cable Car Turntable) at 5 p.m. on a Friday. That's not bad travel time at all in a city of this size. If you're planning on a late night, you may want to make alternate plans for getting back, however. As I said, the streetcar becomes a bus after midnight, which is slower because it runs entirely on surface streets, and it runs much less frequently (about once an hour). In San Francisco, calling 511 will get you info on when and where you can catch it, but it's not a bad idea to have a city cab company's number on your cell phone, just in case you'd rather not wait. That's not going to be an issue, however, unless you're attending a late-night event. The other motel amenity that has gotten mention here is internet access. I do have to say that it can be pretty spotty. My understanding is that the 1930s construction (the very thing that gives the place much of its charm!) is to blame...some of the materials interfere with wireless reception. I've not been able to receive it in the single rooms. In our suite, my daughter was able to get a good connection with no trouble using her regular, full-size laptop, but my netbook just wasn't able to stay connected. The info they give you on check-in does offer suggestions for maximizing your chance of getting a connection, but if it is absolutely essential that you be able to connect to the internet in your motel room during your stay, this might not be the place for you. That said, a coffee place just up the block also has free wireless, so even if you can't get connected in your room, you're not entirely without recourse. What this all comes down to is that, after four years of staying at The Ocean Park, it remains one of my favorite motels in the world (and I've stayed in a lot of motels!). Unless you really need to be right in the middle of the city; or prefer cookie-cutter, plasticized, chain-motel lodgings; this is, in my opinion, the best place to stay on a budget in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: holidaybowl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with husband for one night. Rooms: It is hard to beat this motel in terms of value. The hotel rooms are nice and clean - ours was pretty large because that was all that was available on short notice. The bathrooms are on the small side, as this is a historic building. The beds were what you would expect for a motor inn; very clean but not 4-star hotel quality mattresses. The windows are original, so you may here some street noise (our room was toward the back of the hotel). Service: The desk clerk was very friendly, helpful and chatty. He let us know about great places to eat nearby (see below). We only stayed one night, so I can't comment on the quality of the housekeeping. The room was spotless when we arrived. Since this is a motor inn, other service items like a business center, room service, etc. are not provided. On the plus side, having free parking makes all of these short-comings worth it. Hotels in the city center charge an arm and a leg for parking. Location: The motel is located on the L-Taraval MUNI line that goes directly into the city center along Market St. (all the way to the Embarcadero). It is a relatively short walk to the San Francisco Zoo and a medium-length walk to get to the ocean front (bring a sweater!) Some other reviews mentioned the noise from the MUNI line, but I didn't notice. Compared with other cities of similar size, this motel is located in a relatively quiet area. Several blocks away (probably too long to walk) there are a few blocks of cheap, excellent restaurants serving primarily Asian cuisine. Bottom line: The hotel is an outstanding value, located in a relatively quiet residential area of San Francisco. If you have a car, want a low-cost place to stay, and don't mind driving a few minutes to get into the city center, this place is perfect. I probably would advise against staying here without a car - it is a longish ride on public transit to get to the city sights.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a wonderful motel at a terrific price!”
Reviews.Author: jesbeja
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Ocean Park with its charming art deco style and comfortable rooms. It is a taste of the old San Francisco just a block from the beach.. The owners, who manage the motel, could not have been more hospitable. I look forward to staying there on my next trip to San Francisco. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel In SF”
Reviews.Author: mjsross
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite place to stay in SF. The proprietors are wonderfully nice people, and the rooms have met our needs perfectly on the two occasions we've stayed here. We've made use of the small playground they have in the back yard as well as the super close proximity to the ocean and the zoo. For a family, I'd recommend their suites- they have suites with kitchens and without- this time we had a two bedroom suite that worked perfectly for myself and my kids (2.5 years and 4 months). It's affordable, unpretentious, stylish, comfortable, and everything you'd want in a family friendly place to stay. As an added bonus, the L Taraval runs right on the street in front of the motel, so its not difficult to get downtown with public transportation. We really love this place, and are grateful that the proprietors continue to run such a wonderful motel. Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleFamilyFive
Reviews.Content: This is a cool art deco place -- the first motor lodge in San Francisco. It is a great deal, a block from the beach and a block from the zoo. The L-Taraval streetcar leaves from across the street, and it is a fun and easy ride to downtown San Francisco and all the tourist sites. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here to see a different side of San Fran...”
Reviews.Author: b0nv0yage2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights on our way home from a long road trip...it was highly ranked on Tripadvisor and was priced reasonably for a suite (with 3 queen beds) in the city (very important to give those car-bound siblings - and their parents - some personal space). I would recommend requesting a room back off the street as the trolley runs regularly right next to the motel, day and night. The location was perfect for our one-day visit to the Science Academy in Golden Gate Park, which was just 4 miles to the north. (We hopped on the bus and transferred to the trolley and were there in about a half hour.) We also got to see parts of SF we wouldn't have gone to if we hadn't been staying in this hotel, but make sure it fits your requirements as it's definitely in a different area (the zoo is very close). I read the reviews, so I didn't expect a fancy place...and found just what I was looking for: an older, extremely well kept art deco-style motel with character. I will agree with the reviewer who said it was a tad awkward to knock on the owners' window when you needed help, but they never did made us feel that way. Surprise...it was quite chilly in the city the day we were there, so the HOT hot tub was the perfect way to end both nights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Personal Motel”
Reviews.Author: MrBeluga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Park Motel because, as part of our tour of the USA, my mum was visiting and we needed a family suite. The lady who took our call was extremely helpful and pleasant, talking through the various family options. We decided on our room, and being a Monday, she was kind enough to offset some of the San Francisco tax, which is especially high. The result was a bargain. The suite was on the garden side, which I would strongly recommend as the tram runs past on the street side, and included two bedrooms with their own access off the hall, and a communal bathroom. The rooms were very nicely finished, clean, comfortable and homely. There were other options which included a kitchenette and seating area, which would have suited parents with children well, but to reach one bedroom, you have to pass through the other. They'll be very happy to assist you in your choice. In our suite we had a fridge, microwave and coffee making facilities. The owners are always on hand to answer questions and offer advice, and are extremely courteous. They provide a helpful compendium of information on arrival with reccomendations for eating, drinking and sightseeing. There is a communal hot tub in a gorgeous sheltered courtyard area. They only give out two keys, so it's likely you will have it to yourself, as we did. They provide extra towels and the temperature is simmering point! Location wise, the Motel looks a little far out from the centre, but the tram runs from across the street and connects throughout the city. You wouldn't need a car to stay here, but there is parking. The beach is just a short walk, great when the weather plays ball, and there are numerous cafes and restaurants in the immediate area to suit all budgets and tastes. The upside of being a little further from the centre is that the area feels safe and friendly, a family neighbourhood. Overall, the Ocean Park Motel is a great choice for a visit to San Francisco, a personal, homely motel with style, lovely owners and a great range of accomodation. Clean, safe and real value for money. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Eriksen1
Reviews.Content: Ocean park motel lays a bit from SF but the munirail goes direct to centrum. Compare too other hotels in SF its great value for the money. We travelled with 3 children and room was big and plenty of space. Its overall a great pleasuere too stay here, the only thing too say something about is that its not mutch of restaurangs and supermarkets in the neighborhood so you will be needing a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this motel!”
Reviews.Author: FLWfan
Reviews.Content: Our son was graduating from SFSU and we chose the Ocean Park as it is about 3 miles to his place and less than that to campus. Lovely grounds and cozy rooms made this a great choice for our SF visit. The muni to downtown goes right by, so you can hop on and be downtown in about 20 minutes. Not luxury accomodations by any means, but clean and a throwback to the old days of lodging. Try it if you have no desire to be in the tourist areas of SF.

Reviews.Title: “An attractive, well-run motel in a suburban location with good light rail access to the city.”
Reviews.Author: Boomer61
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Park has plenty of charm. We stayed for two nights initially and then another night after our trip to Yosemite. The suburban location near San Francisco Zoo (and the beach) was a good alternative to staying in the CBD. There is good light rail access to the city via the MUNI-L line ($1.50 pp, $2 from Jul 09). The rooms were clean and well-presented and the operators very friendly and helpful. Good off-street parking for cars. Pros - Art Deco charm, much lower cost than a city hotel and a handy location to attractions (if you have a car or are happy to use public transport). Cons - as mentioned by others, the light rail can be rather noisy in the front rooms! Go for a rear room and all will be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, service and a slice of nostalgia in one brief stay”
Reviews.Author: coffeemonster
Reviews.Content: We flew in to San Francisco and needed a place to overnight before starting a road trip. The choice was functional airport hotel - plastic and synthetic, expensive city centre - soulless and complicated for parking, or Ocen Park Motel in the Sunset District. This is a genuine slice of San Francisco history, the sort of thing you saw in 1950's Hollywood detective films and none the worse for that. Once I saw it on the web I just had to stay there and I wasn't disappointed. Old doesn't mean bad, it means lovely, nor does it mean shabby, it means contemporary and comfortable. Indeed had it not been for the lack of air conditioning, it would have been perfect, but then when you arrive to record breaking unseasonal temperatures in the 90's, the motel can hardly be blamed; and hey just open a window, thats how they did it back then in the black and white films. This is a one off place, with great service from the owners. Turn your back on plastic and synthetic, and enjoy a simpler more personal experience. Stay here, its marvellous.

Reviews.Title: “It's now our favorite place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: sierracousin
Reviews.Content: This is a charming, affordable, comfortable and friendly place to lodge. It's a quiet place only a few blocks from the zoo and Ocean Beach in a real SF neighborhood. We took the "L" streetcar to and from downtown which was easier than driving. The owners are wonderful people who made us feel very much at home.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a gem , right next to the Beach”
Reviews.Author: VEH63
Reviews.Content: The owners could not be more accommodating and the service is so friendly. I needed wireless connection and I was not disapointed . The rooms are very clean and the beds are fantastic. I felt so comfortable and secure in this place away from home. It is a real "find" with easy access to SF. In the morning you can stroll over to the coffee shop around the corner and enjoy breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price and Clean”
Reviews.Author: jayaamazing
Reviews.Content: The title sums it up for me, fair price and extremely clean. Lots of parking, and friendly staff.. nice location near the beach. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Why would you EVER want to stay downtown again!?!?!”
Reviews.Author: DoeHEAD
Reviews.Content: I found this place on Tripadvisor after despairing of the current high cost of downtown accommodations. The Ocean Park is the perfect antidote: affordable, laid-back, uniquely charming, immaculately-kept, and smack-dab adjacent to one of the MUNI Metro lines that takes you directly into the Market Street subway. Furthermore, it's not only handy to San Francisco State Univ. and the airport, but within walking distance of the Zoo and the magnificent Pacific Ocean beach. It's easy to forget that the Ocean Park is 70+ years old. My second-floor room was both spacious and cozy; with a warm-colors decor, a flat-screen TV and an amazingly comfortable bed, a clean, bright black-and-white tiled bathroom and a full walk-in closet. Though it's true that there are only a couple walking-distance diners, there are some wonderful neighborhood resturants, including authentic Chinese, and the unique Bashfull Bull Too a short hop (via driving or trolley) away on Taraval. Being a guest here is like having a special refuge, out by the beach, to which you can retreat after spending a busy day in the city. I've stayed in many many places in San Francisco; from high-end Union Square hotels to independent 50s-era two-story motels. None has given me so much basic satisfaction as the Ocean Park Motel. Oddly enough, I recently found a photo of one of the MUNI trolleys that I'd taken while on a visit to the Zoo in 2000. I've attached it with this review, along with a similar shot from Sept. of 2008. Despite being so close, I missed out on staying at the Ocean Park while on that earlier visit. I know better now.

Reviews.Title: “I'm in Love with the Ocean Park Motel”
Reviews.Author: The_Old_Wolf
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling the world for over 30 years. I've stayed in hundreds of hotels and motels, from scary tumble-down wrecks to five-diamond establishments in dozens of countries on four continents. I have never enjoyed a stay anywhere more than the Ocean Park Motel in San Francisco. A 1930's Art-Deco construction, this motel has been lovingly refurbished and updated by the couple who runs it. It is clearly a labor of love. My room in the inner courtyard, which is immaculately groomed, was obviously old construction, but spotlessly clean with everything in working order. The TV was a modern LCD flat-screen with functional remote and a more than adequate selection of cable channels. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in, including my own - and that's saying a lot. The price was so reasonable - especially for San Francisco - that I thought I might have been undercharged. Location pros are a two-minute walk to the beach, a streetcar stop just outside the front door, and the San Francisco Zoo just across the street. Cons are a lack of other things to do or places to eat within walking distance - and a streetcar stop just outside the front door (the trolley noise might bother some people, but I didn't even notice it. The hotel thoughtfully provides wax earplugs on your night stand should this be a problem for you.) I plan on staying here again, and again, and again. I would recommend it to anyone who has a taste for something with much more charm and character than the run-of-the-mill paper-maché motel, and who doesn't mind staying in a place that evokes memories of an era tragically long-gone. Brass and glass you won't find, but in exchange you shall have an abundance of warmth and a personal touch that makes it seem much more like a home than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and friendly place to stay. Not to mention really affordable $”
Reviews.Author: ShiaNY
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean place to stay. Especially for families with kids or people that appreciate a quiet and friendly environment. Initially had a hard time locating the place and would appreciate an option to book online. I’m glad we found this site as it was both reasonable and enjoyable. Would stay there again and recommend with comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable with character!”
Reviews.Author: DJMadruga
Reviews.Content: I just dropped my daughter off to begin college at SFSU! We're from San Diego, not at all familiar with the Bay Area, so were a bit overwhelmed at the prospect of figuring where to stay, getting her moved in using public transportation and and still seeing some sights. For the spring SFSU "Sneak Preview" we stayed at the Grant Plaza in Chinatown (after fleeing the terribly located Alpine Inn in Daly City)and loved it, but realized we needed to be closer to the school this time. The Ocean Park Motel was perfect. We got the two-bedroom, three-queen bedroom suite for about $175 per night. Specific instructions are left in the rooms regarding where to eat, how to get there, as well as recommended tours and how to get there all via Muni transport. Muni/bus stops are steps from the motel so not only did we get quickly to and fro from SFSU, but were also easily able to get to the city and up the coast. The room was very clean and comfortable. When the toilet wouldn't stop running, Mark was up to our room immediately and had the problem fixed in minutes. I loved the history of this little place, too, and would definitely recommend it if for whatever reason you want to be out of the bustle of the city. And as far as proximity to SFSU, I'm certain it's the best choice. While the Days Inn is also nearby, it (alas) has no character like this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the ocean park after reading all the great reviews on this site and I have to admit I was a bit disappointed. Given that it's currently ranked 25th in San Francisco I was expecting good value with a semi-decent location. We were staying for 4 nights and if I've known how long it took to get into the downtown area would have definitely booked something a bit closer. To be in the thick of it (Powell / Market) you're looking at around 40 minutes on the MUNI which gets a bit much day after day - you're supposed to be on holiday after all! If you're driving discount this point as the motel offers easy access to the 280 interstate or 101 if you're going up north. The MUNI that passes the front of the motel is pretty noisy so we had requested a back room which was better, however could still hear it at all hours. The owners/grounds were great , owner very helpful and give you a great map of the area/restaurants/etc. The room itself looked nice, however we had real issues with the bathroom as the shower was extremely tempramental and took a good 5 minutes of fiddling to get a constant temparature - not something you want to do each time you shower. Also the toilet / basin were hardwired into the shower as if you used either it would completely throw the temperature you'd so carefully got right out. The bathroom was also VERY small, basically a walk-in toilet with basin and then an alcove for the shower. Overall not bad but I wouldn't stay there again and would advise anyone looking to spend a few days in San Francisco to do some research into closer motels as the commute in is a bit of a hack (27 stops from embarcadero to SF Zoo stop). As I mentioned the owners are helpful, however you do feel like you're interrupting when you have to bang on the window and they look like they're in the middle of dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: BlasianGrl
Reviews.Content: There were four of us in a two bedroom suite. We had two teens (ages 17), my husband and myself. The boys room had two queen beds and our room had one queen bed. The location was perfect as the bus stop was steps away as well as the trolley line. The boys took advantage of the location was once they learned how to use the trolley they were gone exploring all of the time. One day they even visited the zoo (which again is steps away). They give you tons of information when you check in - I would recommend the Bashful Bull for breakfast and it's only a short trolley ride away (about 10 blocks or so). The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. It's so close to the ocean (now that we were not impressed with - the beach was not what we're used to seeing) and transportation stops right outside your door! We were away from the heart of the city but close enough! We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Ocean Park Motel”
Reviews.Author: judeRedding_CA
Reviews.Content: My daughter, grand daughter and I recently spent the night in San Francisco for my grand daughters orientation at San Francisco State University. we wanted a motel close to the college and had the good fortune to pick the Ocean Park Hotel. Not only is it about 1 mile from the college but it is across the street from the Zoo and about 3 blocks from the beach. The Ocean Park is a older motel but is very clean, well maintained and I found the rate to be reasonable. The owners were very helpful with directions and any questions we had. All in all staying there was a excellent choice and a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Like being at home”
Reviews.Author: Agusmaigel
Reviews.Content: We spent three nigths in ocean park motel, even the original plan was to stay two. Motel staff made a strong impression on us, with a friendly and warm welcome and also we really felt like coming home thanks to the peaceful athmosphere in the middle of busy metropol. The yard of the motel was nice, clean and disciplinely cared. First thing we noticed when entering our room was cleanliness and fresh scent. Room was spacious enough for our family, consisting two adults and our year old son. Thanks to low season, I think, staff made us a favour and upgraded us a room with well equipped kitchen for free. Hotel is located next to the end station of cable car, so transportation to the downtown was quick and easy. Also the beach and SFO Zoo are within short walking distance. Our family spent three weeks driving along west coast of US. We visited several hotels and Ocean Park is the only place wich deserved a comment here(I hardly compose anything to Internet). A very tide motel, friendly an genuine staff and also we enjoyed the true retro spirit . I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great & unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tooncesDurham_NC
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Absolutely charming art-deco hotel. Owners very friendly and helpful. Rooms were quaint and old-fashioned but extremely clean. Loved the way the renovations were in keeping with the art deco spirit. Beautiful grounds. A block from the beach, although too cold to swim when we were there. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pride in Ownership”
Reviews.Author: Likeness
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a two week trip to San Francisco and surrounding areas. We decided to make a reservation here for our first night in town because of the reviews and price. It was kind of a strange experience. When you check in, you go to a window and talk to the owner. The hotel grounds are really well kept and the rooms are very clean. The rooms are rather small for our taste, but if you are looking for a clean, reasonably priced place to stay, this is a good place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Cunningham709
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in the San Francisco area in March which included 5 nights at the Ocean Park Motel. We are English and had this notion of a typical American family-run motel and I'm pleased to say that it was exactly what we'd hoped for. The motel itself is located in a quiet part of SF but the tram stop is located right across the street so getting to and from the city centre is very easy. The ocean itself is a 5-minute walk and the zoo is a couple of minutes away. We just loved the tranquil atmosphere and the way the rooms looked out onto a beautiful quiet courtyard (see photos!). SF is a typical busy city with lots to see and do, and it was great to be able to come back each night to this lovely peaceful place. You also felt that you were left alone by the staff - sounds strange, but they provided everything you needed and were always there if you wanted advice or had a problem but weren't 'in your face' like some of the other places we stayed. There was plenty of car parking space and it was easy to get to and from the motel by road, but we found it much easier to use the tram to explore the city itself. Our room was clean, spacious and had everything we needed - maybe not the luxuries you'd expect from a more expensive hotel, but we definitely didn't want for anything. even things like irons, hair dryers etc. were provided willingly if you asked. Would definitely stay here again if are ever in SF!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: CalTraveler45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Park while visiting our daughter at SFSU. The manager was nice and the hotel is located in a residential area. The rooms are dated but quaint. I guess that's part of the classic art deco feel of the hotel. The Ocean Park is very close to the SF Zoo and Beach. For a good place to eat try the Bashful Bull Restaurant a few blocks walk into the neighborhood (Great Breakfast All Day!). Now for the caveat, if you are a light sleeper beware of the Muni Train which passes right in front of the hotel. Our room was at the front of the hotel and the train made a heck of a racket on a regular basis (I didn't sleep well but my wife did). I can't say how loud the train was for those lucky enough to get a room at the rear of the hotel. Overall, our stay wasn't bad but for $125/night I will probably try another hotel just to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Retro Motor Motel”
Reviews.Author: lauracro
Reviews.Content: This is a cute little motor court motel that is everything motels aren't anymore. The art deco exterior is great and the updated interior are awesome. This is old school and you must have no 'motel' expectations when you check in. This is a charming, friendly, clean and comfy place to stay just a couple of blocks from the beach. Take advantage of the list of ideas for touring, dining, and transportation provided when you check in as well. If we stay in SF again, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: Ktrance
Reviews.Content: This was a great place and a very good choice. It is two blocks from the beach, and across the street from the zoo and the train stop to downdown and all of SF. All of SF's major parks were very nearby and all services within a mile. Great location! The place itself has an immaculate green courtyard and grounds and the unit I stayed in was a one bedroom with a kitchen and very spacious, like a one bedroom apartment. Also the value was excellent, it was the same price as some of the tiny hotel rooms around there but vastly superior in every respect. I'll definately stay there agian when visiting SF. Very nice, friendly owners too. I highly recomment it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ocean Park Motel”
Reviews.Author: Drage
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in various hotels in San Francisco (all price ranges) and found that Ocean Park Motel was the very best value and we enjoyed the friendly service, great location and easy access, and very convenient (and FREE) onsite parking. I know that the City and accommodations can be very noisy no matter where you are and we found that this location was one of the quietest. I have also had rooms where you could barely move. This was not the case at Ocean Park Motel. Our room and bathroom were spacious (we had an upstairs room with a microwave and queen and twin bed). It was very easy to travel back and forth from our room to visit our daughter who is now living on the SFSU campus. If we wanted, we could have easily walked to the beach or the zoo from the Motel. We plan many more visits and will always stay at Ocean Park Motel, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and Charming”
Reviews.Author: prizazz
Reviews.Content: I like to stay in quirky little places like this. Being the first motel in San Francisco, you can't expect the polish of a franchise hotel, or the super smooth edges of the super expensive places. I like the history. Art Deco/Art Nouveau of this place is really charming. The rooms are a little small and awkward. But the beds were super comfortable! I don't sleep that well on my own bed (mostly because the cat walks on my face). It was very clean inside and out. Please do not include the sidewalks outside the establishment. That is city/county responsibility. The muni on rails can be heard on the street from some rooms, which I thought was romantic. It woke me up but it didn't piss me off. And the neighbor garden with all the gnomes! You can only see this from certain rooms, but boy, what a trip! And come on, they have a hot tub. You can walk to the beach and the zoo. I found the proprietors very kind and polite. I recommend it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Fun - Especially for Families”
Reviews.Author: BaliThai
Reviews.Content: My two small children and I stayed at the Ocean Park Motel in August of this year. What a fun experience! We had a two room unit with a kitchen - and while it was small, it was charming and just fine. There were two queen beds, a tiny 1920s bathroom and a tiny 1920's kitchen (w/apt. range and 3/4 size refrigerator) that was perfect. My children loved that I could sit at the end of the tiny table and reach EVERYTHING in the kitchen while sitting down! I am sorry to read that a few people had bad experiences here - the comment about a lack of an elevator had me laughing however. Any homework on this hotel would have told you that! :-) Most of the rooms were on the ground floor - and the buildings are actually on a "campus" of sorts - some surround a courtyard and are in single story buildings - and some branch off on the same property around the on-site parking and garden area and are two-level buildings. Our unit faced the courtyard which was nice and quiet, and we got a nice breeze when we opened up the kitchen window and the front door. There are even covered parking places (first come first get), although they are old fashioned small carports. If you have a big car, it will be a tight squeeze! They do have a little garden area with a "playground" that is really a simple wood play structure with a swing and slide. And it was just fine for two little kids who occasionally wanted to burn off some energy when I just wanted to sit down. The motel is right on the Muni train line (N-Taraval) and a block from the beach and the SF Zoo. There are many fun neighborhood restaurants nearby and a couple of grocery stores within short driving distance (or take the train to 18th and Taraval). There is a killer gelato place (Marco Polo gelato) around 23rd and Taraval (might be off a few blocks) and it has standard and unusual flavors -- all of which are divine! The owners print up a list of recommended restaurants, close-by things to see and do, and services (laundry!). They are kind and nice, and the place is well kept for its age. If you are looking for a place with character in the Sunset, w/easy access to transportation, and a kitchen -- this is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A charming place! Exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: TheresaMc
Reviews.Content: Our room on the courtyard was very small but completely sufficient for two nights. Quirky but safe neighborhood filled with endless varieties of rowhouses; great restaurants along Taraval! Our proprietors have really kept the restored motel in great shape, with a peaceful, low-key feeling (you can hear the ocean and the Muni -- all day and night, but it's pleasant). Easy to check in and out. There are no luxuries except peace and quiet and a clean airy place to use as a base camp, especially if you want to retire each night to someplace other than the bustle of downtown SF. We'll return next year!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel108
Reviews.Content: We use tripadvisor all the time, and I don't recall ever seeing such misleading reviews. This place is really dreadful. Art Deco my eye! More like this makes Super 8 look good! You check in outside through a bullet proof cage, haul your luggage up 2 flights of stairs (no elevatiors, of course), and into a room that you can barely turn around in. The refrigerator and coffee maker (broken) are in the closet (no other room for them), The hotel is right in front of where the trolleys turn around so be prepared not to sleep much -- the noise is awful. Not a glass in the place to brush your teeth, no clock, no hairdryer, no desk for a computer (but not to worry, the wireless didn't work most of the time), no food anywhere (not even a vending machine), etc. Everything in the place was old and smelled musty. That we were charged over $120 a night for such an awful place (our room was an "upgraded one" even) still infuriates me. Plus the location is awful if you want to go anywhere but to the beach. My advice; pay $30 more and stay someplace decent.

Reviews.Title: “loved the ocean park motel”
Reviews.Author: travelmonk
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night at the ocean park before flying back but we really liked it. The guy at the reception was super friendly and provided us with lots of useful information ( map, history of the motel and recommendations for restaurants etc ). The Art Deco style of the motel is great, the courtyard fantastic. The room was nicely decorated and very clean. The location 2 streets off the beach and the zoo is not very central but you have easy access to public transport which gets you downtown in about 30 mins. If you come by car there is free parking. Very safe area and you can hear the ocean from your room. The motel does not provide breakfast but there are a few cafés and a deli in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: beekeeper5
Reviews.Content: We spent part of our visit to SF in the main part of the city, and part at the Ocean Park Motel based on the reviews it received, and our desire to have a unique experience. The Ocean Park is a great motel for the right kind of folks. The art deco style and beautiful courtyard are refreshing in an age of cookie cutter motels. We had two rooms, which provided plenty of space for our family of five. The owners of the motel are friendly and provide plenty of useful information on check-in. We loved being a couple blocks from the ocean. We could run on the beach after a day of sightseeing or collect sand dollars and watch the sunset. The zoo was about a block away -- we could hear the monkeys in the morning. The motel is located in a neighborhood, which we enjoyed. There was no air conditioning, but the windows opened -- very refreshing. The first stop on the L line was across the street, so it was easy to get into the city. It took us about a half hour to get to Market and Powell, but we enjoyed the trip. Our only issue was with towels -- housekeeping never left enough for five people, so we had to retrieve more from the office. On the last day, they were out of towels. Other than the towels, we had an absolutely lovely visit..

HotelInfo.Name: Ocean Park Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 2690 46th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94116
